properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 17 at 9:25PM EST until January 18 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton NY
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow and some mixed precipitation expected. Total snow
accumulations of 2 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of a
light glaze expected. Southeast winds gusting as high as 35
mph will create areas of blowing and drifting snow.

* WHERE...In Pennsylvania, Bradford county. In New York, Yates,
Steuben, Schuyler and Chemung counties.

* WHEN...Steady snow quickly develops mid to late morning
Saturday and continues through the afternoon hours. Some sleet
could mix in during the afternoon. The snow tapers off to snow
showers, light sleet and patchy freezing drizzle Saturday
evening.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates could briefly be around 1
inch per hour late morning or midday Saturday. Temperatures
will be in the upper 10s to 20s on Saturday, rising into the
lower 30s by evening.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania
Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on
driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania
roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadways,
and traffic conditions.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM TO 10 PM EST SATURDAY
